customer_addr:
6500 E. Messner Rd.
Apple Creek, OH 44606

citations.narrative:
The complete physical examinations from head to tail on 6 adult dogs by the attending veterinarian has not been
completed since 19June2023. Failure to have each dog examined at least once every 12 months may result in delay of
treatment and diagnosis for disease, illness, or injury. Correct by ensuring that a complete physical examination from
head to tail of each dog by the attending veterinarian is conducted not less than once every 12 months.
Correct by 7November2024

The facility is not following the program of veterinary care for vaccinations. The Program of Veterinary Care currently
prescribes dogs will be vaccinated for distemper, parvo, and leptospirosis annually and rabies at 1 year and then every 3
years going forward.
2 adult dogs are not up to date on their Distemper or Parvo vaccines:
-Kiah#0142
-Bear#6551
1 adult dog did not have a record of a current Distemper or Parvo vaccine
-Oakley#7940
1 adult dog is not up to date on her rabies vaccine:
-Kiah#0142
7 adult dogs are not up to date on their Leptospirosis vaccines:
-Bear #6551
-Maggie #6837
-Oakley#7940
-Bella#3512
-Sunny#7872
-Kiah#0142
-Sadie#7637
Failure to follow the preventative care schedule for vaccinations in the Program of Veterinary Care does not ensure the
dogs are receiving appropriate protection against contagious and deadly diseases such as distemper, parvo,
leptospirosis, and rabies which can lead to illness and discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the vaccination
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian in the Program of Veterinary Care to protect the dogs from deadly or
contagious diseases.
The facility has not performed the annual heartworm testing or fecal sampling for internal parasites. Medical records show
the last samples obtained were in June 2023. The Program of Veterinary Care states heartworm testing and fecal exams
will be performed annually with 25% of the kennel being sampled for heartworm and 10% of the kennel being sampled for
intestinal parasites. Failure to follow the parasite control program approved by the attending veterinarian may not properly
protect the dogs from parasites and may allow illness to go undetected and untreated, which may cause pain and
unnecessary discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the parasite control testing schedule approved by the
attending veterinarian to protect the dogs from parasites and other pests (worms, coccidia, giardia and heartworm) and
have the dogs tested annually.
Correct by 7 November 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The complete physical examinations from head to tail on 6 adult dogs by the attending veterinarian has not been 
completed since 19June2023. Failure to have each dog examined at least once every 12 months may result in delay of 
treatment and diagnosis for disease, illness, or injury. Correct by ensuring that a complete physical examination from 
head to tail of each dog by the attending veterinarian is conducted not less than once every 12 months. 
 
Correct by 7November2024 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is not following the program of veterinary care for vaccinations. The Program of Veterinary Care currently 
prescribes dogs will be vaccinated for distemper, parvo, and leptospirosis annually and rabies at 1 year and then every 3 
years going forward.  
2 adult dogs are not up to date on their Distemper or Parvo vaccines: 
-Kiah#0142 
-Bear#6551  
 
1 adult dog did not have a record of a current Distemper or Parvo vaccine 
-Oakley#7940 
 
1 adult dog is not up to date on her rabies vaccine: 
-Kiah#0142 
 
7 adult dogs are not up to date on their Leptospirosis vaccines: 
-Bear #6551 
-Maggie #6837 
-Oakley#7940 
-Bella#3512 
-Sunny#7872 
-Kiah#0142

-Sadie#7637 
Failure to follow the preventative care schedule for vaccinations in the Program of Veterinary Care does not ensure the 
dogs are receiving appropriate protection against contagious and deadly diseases such as distemper, parvo, 
leptospirosis, and rabies which can lead to illness and discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the vaccination 
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian in the Program of Veterinary Care to protect the dogs from deadly or 
contagious diseases.  
 
 
The facility has not performed the annual heartworm testing or fecal sampling for internal parasites. Medical records show 
the last samples obtained were in June 2023. The Program of Veterinary Care states heartworm testing and fecal exams 
will be performed annually with 25% of the kennel being sampled for heartworm and 10% of the kennel being sampled for 
intestinal parasites. Failure to follow the parasite control program approved by the attending veterinarian may not properly 
protect the dogs from parasites and may allow illness to go undetected and untreated, which may cause pain and 
unnecessary discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the parasite control testing schedule approved by the 
attending veterinarian to protect the dogs from parasites and other pests (worms, coccidia, giardia and heartworm) and 
have the dogs tested annually.  
 
Correct by 7 November 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
